ratings.comment: THIS IS FOR MATH 540. Professor Ball did not reply to emails, good luck getting in touch with him. He will not provide you with his notes under any circumstances and will not post homework solutions. He also will post exam reviews, but it took asking him 10+ times for solutions, and those were not comprehensive. I would not recommend him.
Terrible lecture, terrible grading, too much to review before final. Avoid this lecturer.

I'm seeing these awful reviews and wanted to address that students were so disrespectful in his class and very few were paying any attention. Those complaining about him writing on a chalkboard are the ones putting in zero effort to follow his lecture notes, so their poor understanding of the material falls on them, not Gavin. He's a great prof.

Ball was a good professor. He was thorough in class and willing to spend time going over confusing concepts when asked to do so. Encouraged the class to ask questions during lectures. I took AP calc last year which definitely gave me a leg up. He is a nice guy and willing to help. Attendance IS mandatory tho, otherwise, you won't understand.

Professor Ball is a fair professor. It was my first time taking Calculous so I didn't understand anything during the lectures, but if you take good notes you will be glad because he does good example problems during the lectures which are very helpful. If you put some effort into this class I believe it is pretty fair.

Trust the process. The tests were all over the place but it averages out. Everything is optional but go!! Especially the discussions. Math is easier for me but the highest class I had previously taken was intro calc junior year of hs. Says funny European things like zed and cuboid. Left handed. Encourages questions in lecture which is nice. :)

I did take calc in high school, so the material wasn't really new for me. But I did know many people in the class who had never taken calc before and it was extremely hard for them. Only take him if you have an understanding of the material already. Overall, low averages but generous curves. Section worksheets were very helpful. Organized lectures.
Good professor. He gave medium to hard midterms and final but gave a generous curve for the final grade.

Please do yourself a favor and dont take him. The tests are so hard for no reasons, and the study guides make them seem much easier than they actually are. He makes simple concepts extremely confusing and is just a hard teacher to have.

Gavin is a good lecturer if you pay close attention. However, his midterms and final exam are tough. He posts a study guide, but refuses to give you an answer key to try and check yourself. He also does review problems on the board before the test, but skips the ones that are similar to the test for some reason?

Professor Ball was a great professor. He gave good lectures and always made sure show useful examples. Many of the negative reviews on here for 211 this semester are wrong. The midterm 1 average was 60 and the midterm 2 average was 81. He never sent a rude email after the midterm. He spent 2 review classes for each test going over the study guides.

This class is just disgusting. There are so many red flags in this teacher and here is a list of few. You skip a class because you're sick? Ur done. He gives study guide with no answer sheet. I mean study guide is there to help us but if he does not share an answer sheet, how on earth would be know what we are doing wrong. He is too cockkkky tbh.

Dr. Ball is genuinely a nice person. You will be writing a lot during his lectures, but you will thank yourself for it when you look back to review for tests. His notes are laid out very nicely and are organized (ex. term + definition + example), and are not directly from the textbook.

Reason why I say that lecture is not mandatory is because you will have a better time trying to teach these concepts yourself. He makes easy concepts seem harder than it is. First midterm was super hard (average: 50%, second was easier (average: 70%). I would ONLY recommend this class to people who already taken calc in the past like in HS.

Reviews from 2020 on here are from the "worst behaved class" (yes, he told us that) Ball has ever had. So, take the harshness from others with a grain of salt. Yes, he does make some things a little more difficult (mostly just the chain rule), but otherwise he is SUPER knowledgeable is always willing to help out during office hours.

Honestly, I'm not trying to bash him as a person, because he seems super nice. Unfortunately, this is the absolute worst math class I have ever taken. I have resorted to paying for tutoring services to help understand the material. He does not record lectures or offer a zoom option, so if you miss class for an illness you have to teach yourself

Prof. Ball is a great professor. He really takes his time during the lectures to make sure the material he is covering is understandable and that there is no confusion. He also goes in more detail than the textbook. He's very adaptable and caring; he even congratulated us when our class test average increased. We're lucky to have him at UW!
He's a good professor
Really hard
Good prof but the tests are difficult
Gavin is a pretty good professor. There is a lot of material covered in class. His first midterm was very tough but the second one was much easier

Makes students feel dumb for not understanding the material because he makes simple concepts as difficult as possible. Sent out a rude email to the class after the midterm average was a 57. The test average should be passing, but hes a mess. Wouldnt recommend this class to anyone.

Professor Ball seemed like he was new at teaching. He writes everything on a chalkboard. He seems like a nice guy but he isn't the best at teaching. The class itself was difficult, but I wouldn't attribute my lack of understanding of the material on his teaching skills.

He's fine. If you pay attention in class and study you'll do fine with the curve. Tests are very difficult if you don't prepare for them. You have to study how to apply concepts to more complicated numbers. Ex: You are learning how to do 9x5 but the test is gonna have 92x44, same concept but just more math.

Average for the first midterm was a 57. That should honestly explain everything. He overcomplicates simple concepts and rambles on the chalkboard with little explanation. He's a good guy, but a terrible professor. If you do poorly on a midterm, you're screwed.

He makes easy concepts way too hard. His test are hard as well and his whole average grade is just trash. I've seen few girls crying during exam because the test was too hard. To be honest, he doesn't deserve the 1 star but that is the lowest feedback I could give him. Good luck guys we can make it.

Gavin tries his best to teach the material but he falls short. He somehow manages to make relatively simple concepts feel incredibly difficult as he explains them in the worst way possible. He spews notes out on a chalk board and that is essentially the whole class.

He's a great professor who is well-spoken and wants to make sure that everyone understands the material. If you have a question mid-lecture, he is always sure to go over it since it may be a question other students have too. He doesn't give quizzes and only has the mid-term and final.
Makes simple concepts much more complicated for the students than they should be.
